message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a novel approach for optimizing non-differentiable and non-decomposable loss functions using surrogate neural networks. This is a topic that is highly relevant to the field of machine learning, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. Specifically, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely category as it covers the core concepts and techniques of machine learning. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also highly relevant as it covers the broader field of AI, which includes machine learning. cs.CV (Computer Vision) is another likely category as it is a field that heavily relies on loss functions for tasks such as object detection and segmentation. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is relevant as the proposed approach involves training neural networks. Finally, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is a possible category as the paper mentions using set-wise models that are invariant to the order of mini-batch instances, which could be relevant to natural language processing tasks.
